DOC.brief_title: Abbreviated Breast MRI Digital Tomosynthesis Mammography Screening Women With Dense Breasts
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To compare rate detection invasive cancer abbreviate breast ( AB ) -magnetic resonance ( MR ) digital tomosynthesis mammography ( DBT ) . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To compare positive predictive value ( PPV ) biopsy , call back rate , short-term follow rate AB-MR DBT initial 1 year follow study . II . To estimate compare sensitivity specificity AB-MR DBT , use 1 year follow define reference standard . III . To compare patient-reported short-term quality life relate diagnostic test AB-MR DBT use Testing Morbidities Index . IV . To compare willingness return test AB-MRI versus ( v ) DBT within recommend screen interval explore factor associate willingness return screening . V. To compare tumor biology invasive cancer ductal carcinoma situ ( DCIS ) detect AB-MR DBT . VI . To estimate incident cancer rate 3 year follow year-1 AB-MR/DBT patient return standard screening . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( DBT , AB-MR ) : Participants undergo DBT follow AB-MR 10 minute day baseline 1 year . ARM II ( AB-MR , DBT ) : Participants undergo AB-MR 10 minute follow DBT day baseline 1year . After completion study , patient follow yearly 3 year .

female childbearing potential woman , regardless sexual orientation whether undergone tubal ligation , meet follow criterion : 1 ) undergone hysterectomy bilateral oophorectomy ; 2 ) naturally postmenopausal least 24 consecutive month ( i.e. , menses time precede 24 consecutive month ) Women childbearing potential must strongly advise use accept effective method contraception abstain sexual intercourse duration participation study Patient 's breast density must know ; patient must mammographically dense breast ( American College Radiology [ ACR ] Breast Imaging [ BI ] Reporting Data System Atlas [ RADS ] categories 3 4 ) mostrecent prior screen Patient must asymptomatic breast disease undergo routine screening Patient must know breast cancer ( DCIS invasive cancer ) , currently undergo treatment breast cancer , plan surgery high risk lesion ( atypical ductal breast hyperplasia [ ADH ] , atypical lobular breast hyperplasia [ ALH ] , lobular breast carcinoma situ [ LCIS ] , papilloma , radial scar ) Patient must take chemoprevention breast cancer Patient must undergo breast ultrasound within 12 month prior randomization Patient must previously breast MRI Patient must agree undergo screen ultrasound ( breast ) duration 1 year study period screen ultrasound add benefit woman undergo breast MRI Patient must suspect highrisk breast cancer , define American Cancer Society ( ACS ) breast MR screening recommendation ( lifetime risk > = 2025 % ) Patient must able undergo breast MRI contrast enhancement ;
